Religious Tours in West Bengal

Sacred sites where parts of Goddess Sati's body fell

Kolkata

Kalighat Toe

One of the 51 Shakti Peeths, dedicated to Goddess Kali

Significance:

Major pilgrimage site for Hindus

Rampurhat - Birbhum

Tarapith Eye ball

Sacred Shakti Peeth dedicated to Goddess Tara

Significance:

Powerful tantric center

Bakreswar - Birbhum

Bakreswar Forehead & Brows

Ancient Shakti Peeth with hot water springs

Significance:

Known for healing properties

Nalhati - Birbhum

Nataleshwari Throat

Sacred Shakti Peeth dedicated to Goddess Nataleshwari

Significance:

Ancient pilgrimage site

Bolpur - Birbhum

Kankhaleswari Waist

Sacred Shakti Peeth near Santiniketan

Significance:

Peaceful spiritual environment

Katwa - Burdwan

Attahas or Ma Fullara Lips

Sacred Shakti Peeth with ancient temple

Significance:

Historical and religious importance

Ketugram - Burdwan

Bahula Left arm

Sacred Shakti Peeth dedicated to Goddess Bahula

Significance:

Ancient spiritual center

Malda

Ma Jahura 3 faces of Ma

Unique Shakti Peeth with triple-faced deity

Significance:

Rare spiritual manifestation

Khanakul - Hoogly

Ratnavali / Vibhash Shakti or Anandamayee Right shoulder

Sacred Shakti Peeth with divine energy

Significance:

Known for spiritual bliss

Tamluk - East Midnapur

Bargabhima or Bhim Kali Left ankle

Ancient Shakti Peeth with historical significance

Significance:

Connected to Mahabharata era

Murshidabad

Kiriteshwari Crown

Sacred Shakti Peeth in historic Murshidabad

Significance:

Royal patronage and heritage

Falakata - Jalpaiguri

Trisrota Left leg

Sacred Shakti Peeth in North Bengal

Significance:

Natural beauty and spirituality
